answers.answer: Hi, yes he can gradually improve. He will need to consult a physiotherapist, he will chart out a program based on his present muscle strength and will gradually build up his exercise so that he improves both in his movements and his posture. Please consult one. Ensure to have his diabetes well controlled. And good luck with his therapy. Regards.

question: Hi,My dad had a stroke 7 yrs back which paralyzed his left side of his body. With physiotherapy he gained mobility and could walk in 5 months (after which he started to go back for work) and he stopped his physiotherapy.However his recovery was only 50%, he cannot move his left arms and legs as good as his right.What physiotherapy exercises should be done for hands and legs (with pictures or videos) ?With physiotherapy now, is there a possibility of any more improvement ?Plus, his body is tilted towards his right after the stroke, as he exerts pressure on his right. Is there a way to get it back to normal or is this tilt permanent ?P.S: He is 64 years old now and a diabetes patient.
title: Physiotherapy exercises for complete recovery in stroke patients
